DataElement.preferredDefinition: A demographic parameter indicating the highest level of education attained by a human being.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A demographic parameter indicating the number of years of schooling or the highest level of achievement at school by a human being.

Property.preferredDefinition: A demographic parameter indicating the number of years of schooling or the highest level of achievement at school.

Concepts.definition: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/1/07 removed CSI reference to proposed.  9/14/07-released.  6/11/07- Completed to support caBIG Education Level standard.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of education levels used to capture the highest level of education attained by a person.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: A secondary school that usually includes grades 9 through 12.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A secondary school that usually includes grades 9 through 12.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bachelor's degree is an award (baccalaureate or equivalent degree, as determined by the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Education) conferred by a college, university, or other postsecondary education institution as official recognition for the successful completion of a program of studies, that normally requires at least four years of full-time equivalent college-level work. This includes bachelor's degrees conferred in a five-year cooperative program.

Concepts.definition: Bachelor's degree is an award (baccalaureate or equivalent degree, as determined by the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Education) conferred by a college, university, or other postsecondary education institution as official recognition for the successful completion of a program of studies, that normally requires at least four years of full-time equivalent college-level work. This includes bachelor's degrees conferred in a five-year cooperative program.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A doctorate awarded in certain fields where most holders of the degree are not engaged primarily in scholarly research and academic activities, but rather in a profession, such as law, medicine, music, or ministry.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The Doctor's Degree is the highest award a student can earn for graduate study. The doctor's degree classification includes such degrees in any field.

Concepts.definition: A doctorate awarded in certain fields where most holders of the degree are not engaged primarily in scholarly research and academic activities, but rather in a profession, such as law, medicine, music, or ministry.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The Doctor's Degree is the highest award a student can earn for graduate study. The doctor's degree classification includes such degrees in any field.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a person has attended high school but did not complete high school and did not receive a high school diploma.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a person has attended high school but did not complete high school and did not receive a high school diploma.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: High School Completion or General Equivalency Diploma (GED) Completion

ValueMeaning.preferredName: High School Completion or General Equivalency Diploma (GED) Completion
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that a person has attended high school and has received a high school diploma.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Indicates that a person has received a General Equivalency Diploma in lieu of a high school diploma.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that a person has attended high school and has received a high school diploma.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Indicates that a person has received a General Equivalency Diploma in lieu of a high school diploma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that a person has attended college but that they did not receive any degree.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that a person has attended college but that they did not receive any degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.
A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
